alternative_parents.description: Steroids carrying a hydroxyl group at the 6-position of the steroid backbone.
alternative_parents.name: 6-hydroxysteroids

alternative_parents.description: Steroids carrying a alpha-hydroxyl group at the 3-position of the steroid backbone.
alternative_parents.name: 3-alpha-hydroxysteroids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an aliphatic ring substituted with at least one hydroxyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Cyclic alcohols and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

ancestors: Dihydroxy bile acids, alcohols and derivatives
Hydroxy bile acids, alcohols and derivatives

class.description: Compounds based on the cyclopenta[a]phenanthrene carbon skeleton, partially or completely hydrogenated; there are usually methyl groups at C-10 and C-13, and often an alkyl group at C-17. By extension, one or more bond scissions, ring expansions and/or ring contractions of the skeleton may have occurred.
class.name: Steroids and steroid derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as dihydroxy bile acids, alcohols and derivatives. These are compounds containing or derived from a bile acid or alcohol, and which bears exactly two carboxylic acid groups.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing or derived from a bile acid or alcohol, and which bears exactly two carboxylic acid groups.
direct_parent.name: Dihydroxy bile acids, alcohols and derivatives

annotations: C24 bile acids, alcohols, and derivatives

intermediate_nodes.description: Bile acids, alcohols or derivatives bearing at least hydroxyl group.
intermediate_nodes.name: Hydroxy bile acids, alcohols and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing an alcohol or acid derivative of cholic acid.
subclass.name: Bile acids, alcohols and derivatives

substituents: Dihydroxy bile acid, alcohol, or derivatives

superclass.description: Fatty acids and their derivatives, and substances related biosynthetically or functionally to these compounds.
superclass.name: Lipids and lipid-like molecules
